text: But the Duke is wrong when he implies that young people prefer unskilled jobs. Countless numbers who want training are denied it. One area electricity board in 1958 offered six craft apprenticeships and received 450 applications, of whom 100 were considered suitable by the board. There were only 17 vacancies for the 58 boys who passed the Admiralty exams for Rosyth dockyard last year. But the Dnte is wrony when he jmplies thst young people e deed it.
